intro: Allamanda laevis, commonly known as the white allamanda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves that are typically oval in shape. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Allamanda laevis is known for its rapid growth and ability to produce abundant blooms throughout the growing season.
